definition.name: Setup kwok
definition.description: This action sets up kwok/kwokctl for use in your workflow

inputs.name: kwok-version
inputs.description: Specific version of command to install, defaults to latest release

inputs.name: repository
inputs.description: Repository is kwok's repository, will use release from this repository, defaults same as uses in this step

steps.name: Install ${{ inputs.command }}
steps.run:
if [[ -f /usr/local/bin/${{ inputs.command }} ]]; then
  echo "Found ${{ inputs.command }} in /usr/local/bin, skipping installation"
  exit 0
fi

if [[ -z "${KWOK_VERSION}" ]]; then
  echo "Fetching latest version..."
  KWOK_VERSION="$(curl "https://api.github.com/repos/${KWOK_REPO}/releases/latest" | jq -r '.tag_name')"
  if [[ -z "${KWOK_VERSION}" ]]; then
    echo "Failed to fetch latest version"
    exit 1
  fi
  if [[ "${KWOK_VERSION}" == "null" ]]; then
    echo "Failed to fetch latest version"
    exit 1
  fi
  echo "Latest version is ${KWOK_VERSION}"
fi

echo "Installing ${{ inputs.command }} ${KWOK_VERSION}..."
wget -O ${{ inputs.command }} "https://github.com/${KWOK_REPO}/releases/download/${KWOK_VERSION}/${{ inputs.command }}-$(go env GOOS)-$(go env GOARCH)"
chmod +x ${{ inputs.command }}
sudo mv ${{ inputs.command }} /usr/local/bin/
if ! ${{ inputs.command }} --version; then
  echo "Failed to run ${{ inputs.command }} --version"
  exit 1
fi

evidence.reasoning: This action sets up a specific tool (kwok/kwokctl) for use in workflows, which involves managing dependencies necessary for the workflow's execution. It also relates to infrastructure as it prepares a tool that interacts with Kubernetes.
